org.jooby

Class Jooby.Module

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jooby.Jooby.Module
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Hbs, Jdbc, Json
    Enclosing class:
    Jooby

    public abstract static class Jooby.Module
extends Object
    A module can publish or produces: routes, Body.Parser, Body.Formatter, request modules and any other application specific service or contract of your choice.

    It is similar to Module except for the callback method receives a Mode, Config and Binder.

    A module can provide his own set of properties through the config() method. By default, this method returns an empty config object.

    For example: 
       use(new M1());
   use(new M2());
   use(new M3());
    Previous example had the following order (first-listed are higher priority):
    • System properties
    • application.conf
    • M3 properties
    • M2 properties
    • M1 properties

    A module can provide start/stop methods in order to start or close resources.

    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    edgar
    See Also:
    Jooby.use(Jooby.Module)

    • Method Detail

      • config

        @Nonnull
public com.typesafe.config.Config config()
        Returns:
        Produces a module config object (when need it). By default a module doesn't produce any configuration object.

      • start

        public void start()
           throws Exception
        Callback method to start a module. This method will be invoked after all the registered modules has been configured.
        Throws:
        Exception - If something goes wrong.

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws Exception
        Callback method to stop a module and clean any resources. Invoked when the application is about to shutdown.
        Throws:
        Exception - If something goes wrong.

      • configure

        public abstract void configure(@Nonnull
                               Mode mode,
                               @Nonnull
                               com.typesafe.config.Config config,
                               @Nonnull
                               com.google.inject.Binder binder)
                        throws Exception
        Configure and produces bindings for the underlying application. A module can optimize or customize a service by checking current the application mode and/or the current application properties available from Config.
        Parameters:
        mode - The current application's mode. Not null.
        config - The current config object. Not null.
        binder - A guice binder. Not null.
        Throws:
        Exception - If the module fails during configuration.
